comments.body: Not sure what the answer is, but can we not hard-code to breeze-only path please (Look for the .flag file that breeze creates?)

Hm, hardcoding this for breeze has an advantage that it works out of the box in a single environment. Not hardcoding has no advantages to me. Especially that if someone what to play with it and use other places they will have to adjust it anyway ðŸ¤·ðŸ¼â€â™‚ï¸

Fair enough :)

Could do `"/files//sql_stats.log" if os.path.exisxts("/.dockerenv") else "sql_stats.log"`

But also will accept that this only affects those like me who don't use breeze all the time, so I'll fix it up if/when I come to run this script :)

comments.body: How about instead writing the SQLAlchemy logs to a different file? (or a different file _and_ the normal log file) -- we've already got a custom logging config so setting up an `airflow.debug.sql` logger isn't much more work.
Is it necessary? I am unable to find any reason why this can be helpful :)
Mostly to make it less work to extract the timinig logs from amongst the other logs.. But no not required.
